content: AI is pretty bad, especially when attacking. The AI tends not to protect its titan and in fact will lead with it in battle allowing it to be kiled before it can engage with its superior forces.
If this was scalable and with improved AI, it'd be just as good as the classic boardgame!
Make it usable for all playforms, great table top game!
Good. Please fix the issue with Google plus as I cannot play with other people.

Faithful representation of the game Titan by Avalon Hill, sadly needs to be updated as this hinders online play due to Google+ being shut down on April 2, 2019. Look: The game looks totally accurate to the new art style with all the love and polish put into it. Feel: While the AI will pose a moderate challenge to seasoned players, it is enough not to discourage new players until they understand the game and move on to human opponents. Playability: Sadly, at this time the multiplayer does not work on Android versions as Google+ was the only way to play online with others on this app (which was last updated back in 2017). This is why my review went from 5 stars to 3 because the replay ability greatly depends on this aspect. There isn't even an option to connect locally on the same network or just input an IP address to play online with others easily. Hopefully the Developer hasn't abandoned this project and is working on a way for us to continue playing. Overall: If you love the game and want to play it with a moderate challenge or want to table swap when visiting people to play with then get it. If you are looking for a way to play with others over distance, the only way is via iPad or the free Java version.
I played the board game with buddies practically five times a week one summer. So happy to find this (and happy to see how much faster we can play)
Loved the Avalon-Hill version of the game when I was younger. This is an excellent digital implementation that carries over all the great aspects of the original while removing tedious elements.

Nice implementation. Am not able to get network play to function on Android build running on BlueStacks, is it because G+ is dead? Biggest flaw in the game is far too often in combat the AI will rush ahead with its Titan and invariably lose and die in ridiculous fashion, making a game's outcome arbitrary and random.
Love the old classic, AI could be better...

Great game, been playing for about a year. Recent trouble logging into the online part. Would appreciate some support. Using Google Play only. Friend using apple application seems to not have the issue.
Titan is awesome game and the app is brilliant venue to play this former tabletop game.
Great game! Just like classic board game.

This app is a straighforward copy of the boardgame, which is a classic my friends and I have enjoyed from my childhood. It could stand a more 3 dimensional approach for the app, including 3 dimension terrain your troops actually move through and figures that battle one another, to give it a more updated look so that it would appeal more to younger folks who prefer games a little more graphic intense. This might boost its popularity a bit which is always nice. But its still a classic!
Enjoyed the biard gane and this is a nostalgic good time
just like Avalon Hill board game!
I love this game.

great run of the board game! wish their was a million players to play with! 
put it on sale for a 1$ every now and then!
I couldnt get past the homepage. everytime I tried to click anything it just didnt respond
The single-player AI is way too aggressive, but it's a great multi-player game. If you enjoy playing the tabletop game with friends, you'll enjoy this one too.

It's good old Titan. Has the original artwork, gameplay is good. The AI is pretty aggressive, so games tend to be short - When they roll a 6 first, they get a warlock. When they get a warlock, they shoot to kill. It's a lot of detail to put on a phone. Pretty tiny on an s7. I bet it's beautiful on a tablet.
An excellent copy of Avalon Hills original Titan boardgame.

I've played the board game for over 20 years.  The AI needs to have some controls for aggressivness. My titan group was being attacked on the first turn by another titan group. Pretty lame. Online mode with friends might be cool though. Sad.

Given the HD in the title, I was kind of expecting this game to use the FULL screen on my tablet. Instead it looks exactly like watching a "classic" TV program on a HIGH DEFINITION television.... a centered screen, with black margins on the left and right. So what does the HD stand for again?
Meticulous rendition of the Avalon hill game.  Love it. Play it every day.
Epic

I love the game and it's a faithful adaption of the original. I would love the option of the expanded (albeit unofficial) rules with undead and expanded game board. Even an option to skip the first tier monsters would be appreciated (which was an option in the original).
Latest update was superb.  If you play the board game Titan this is a must have.
Board game with cheating dice roller to compensate for stupid AI.

This game USED to be five stars.  It has lost some clout.  The game Ai now cheats more than ever.  I used to win about 70 percent of the games, but I have won only two from the last 20 games.  And it's not because the Ai strategies are somehow improved, but rather because of how the game outright cheats.  * It retains 100% information of what is in your stacks.    * It is obvious that it knows its dice rolls in advance of both movement and attack phases.  It will split a 7-stack knowing full well that the short stack will be able to move X-number of spaces without having to sacrifice itself by running into a larger enemy stack three or four spaces ahead of it.   *In battles it makes no different if you have  a stack of native monsters against its stack of non-natives.  It will always get that early kill so it can magically bring in an Angel, while your natives will miss completely or fall one point short. * Worst of all are the Google Play pop-ups requesting you to "Create a Gamer ID" each time you start the game.  You cannot say 'no' and exit from that pop-up; rather you have to click "Next" and go to yet another pop-up.   No option to turn this off. Shame on you Dauba-Dauba!
I'm a fan of the original board game and was happy to be able to play this. Works well and is fun to play. Main difficulty is small size of the board pieces on my tablet screen.
Wonderful implementation of a fondly remembered classic board game!
Fun game, excellent implementation  with  great  artwork, but  difficult  interface.
Fun strategy
Well worth the money!

They did a fantastic job emulating the board game on Android. Plays just like the board game. They reference the board game rules in the app. I've currently played single games, but you can play multiple people on the same device, or play people online. Well worth the money if you enjoyed the board game!

Great version of Titan.  Love the cross platform play between Android and iOS. Also Asynchronous play is awesome for this kind of game.  Would love to see a PC version w/ cross platform play as well.    Graphically game looks great.  Artwork very true to the original.  Would be neat to take advantage of the digital medium and enhance the look of the game boards and creature tiles with some colorful models and animations.  Maybe instead of digital representations of cardboard counters,  you actually see little digital creatures moving/flying attacking with some neat combat animations, etc... but I can see the developer was going for a faithful recreation of the board game though.  The touch controls are a bit iffy, Trying to tap and hold to see what's in a legion can be frustratingly difficult at times.  This definitely needs to be improved.  Please add notifications outside of app to alert you when its your turn.  The game board can be a tight fit on a smaller screen device like a nexus 7.  To help with this, i'd like to see an option for zoom scroll/pan across the map.  Would like to be able to play on 5" phones too.  All in all, great effort.  Looking forward to updates.
This program is exquisitely written, looks fantastic and just what I've been wanting. I've played the board game since it came out in 1981. Don't hesitate to purchase you will not be disappointed.

An excellent implementation that makes a this game simple to play despite its complex ruleset.  If you've played the board game and remember being a bit frustrated with having to keep track of all of the different allowable movements, fear not, as this automatically handles all of that for you.
Really happy this is available on Android, and that it's done so well

Pretty much essential for fans of the board game. Stability is decent - some crashes particularly early in a game, but online has always been recoverable. So great to have the ability to play this classic against real live people any time any where! If you haven't played the boardgame some of the subtleties might easily be missed though. The AI makes for fun games, mind, the dumber bots are really dumb though that should help beginners a bit. Watching the battles play out in a server game is gripping stuff!
I loved this on iPad .... And it's finally on Android! Woot!

I own both the Avalon Hill and Valley Games edition of the board game and the iOS and now the Android app as well.  This is one of my favorite games and this app is a beautiful version of the Valley Games edition.  I like to cast it to my TV using Chromecast so I get a huge board to play on.    This app runs smooth on my Nexus 7 (2013) and I have not had any issues with the software.  I like the graphics and the animations of the pieces run smooth as well.  I also like that cross platform play is available.  Excellent job!
Titan is an awesome dice fest which the computer manages quiet well.
